website_summaries.verdict: Spin the letters on these blocks to create different words as your child learns to read.
pros: Five sets of blocks allow kids to make different 3-letter words
Spin blocks to create different word combinations
Kids can isolate and master specific vowel and consonant sounds
cons: The lettering may not completely match the font children see in books

customer_reviews.title: Bad lettering
customer_reviews.text: This concept is SO GOOD! But the lettering is not the block lettering American preschoolers recognize. Nor is it standard cursive either. SO DISAPPOINTING!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Kenworthy

customer_reviews.title: Cute! But didn’t receive all vowels.
customer_reviews.text: My newly 5 year old really likes these and has learned rhyming words really quickly with them. However, we got a duplicate in our pack and are missing the block series that has the vowel “u” in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole12988

customer_reviews.title: Nonsense words
customer_reviews.text: Horrible choice of letters to make the words on each wooden rod. Very sturdy, but lots of nonsense words. Doesn’t even have the most common early reader words like cat or dog. I’m a teacher and my daughter is 2 years old. I wouldn’t have bought it, if I knew there were nonsense words on it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Boyett

customer_reviews.title: Kindergarten fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my Kindergartener since he is learning to read. They practice a lot of rhyming and these are a great tool for us at home to use to assist in continuing that. 2 negatives. 1- I wish the font was more "block lettering" for easier beginner recognition. 2- we had a few blocks that needed extra sanding after they arrived. Nothing too crazy but still needed to be done.
customer_reviews.author: Riese

customer_reviews.title: Great for the preschooler or early learner in your life.
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old daughter loves this set! From helping her with her lowercase letter recognition to learning some basic words, this set is a keeper! Her teachers have even commented on how much better she is doing at school. This set is also giving her another tool to help teach her the proper way to write each letter. The blocks are sturdy and well made. I have no doubt that they will survive Harper and be in great condition for my son, Jameson, to use.
customer_reviews.author: Haggard Housewife

customer_reviews.title: Great blocks!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my daughter as a toy she can travel with when we are in the car. She is a prereader and knows some of her letters, so I thought these would be fun for her, even if she's not putting letters together to form words yet. Right out of the box, she was turning them, stacking them, pointing at letters she recognizes. I call that a win!
customer_reviews.author: Lyric1985

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a child's interest in learning to structure letters and build words.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson for Christmas. He's 5 years old and is currently into learning words by way of sounding out and spelling. This was a perfect gift for that. He sat contented and proud of all the words and sounds he formed by just moving the blocks. This is a perfect learning, educational tool for young children. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: shoreKass

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how well they were received
customer_reviews.text: I have a granddaughter starting kindergarten and although I disagree with the idea of introducing sight words or phonics so soon to young children she enthusiastically liked these compared to the dreaded and inappropriate worksheets they do on a daily basis. At least this is hands' on and tangible, and you don't have to already be writing the words at the same time you are learning to say them. What a downhill turn for public education in kindergarten.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy L Tuttle

customer_reviews.title: Great Learning to Read Tool
customer_reviews.text: Great product for teaching children to read. Attentive parents & parents of children younger than three (the product states for ages 3 plus) will Supervise usage which is a great idea anyway to draw attention to the words the letters spell. It can teach a child phonetically and regardless will at least position a child through play to have a base of understanding to build upon for reading. At best, children will learn to read some if not all of these words; especially, if it’s all play and not pressured!
customer_reviews.author: Cate

customer_reviews.title: Quality construction, needs more thought in word planning.
customer_reviews.text: My twin 6 year olds are enjoying these so far. I am a bit dismayed at the odd words that can be formed and think there ought to have been more thought in planning the letter combinations. Seem to be high quality wood, however. Wish there was a bag included for them. I picked up a zippered canvas bag at Hobby lobby for about $1. Perfect fit. I'll pass down to my granddaughter in a couple years when she's ready for them if they're still in good shape, which I'm counting on.
customer_reviews.author: S.K.E.

customer_reviews.title: Educational
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my friend's kid. He loves playing with these, I think it's because they spin but, he is learning the words and trying to use them when talking now.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Holleran

customer_reviews.title: Good learning tool
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality reading blocks. My kiddo is a bit older than the 36months on the box. I wish I had known about these a year or two ago. His class is working on word families right now though, so these are helpful. I wish there were extra blocks with more letters that could be interchanged by maybe unscrewing the side and swapping them out, but if he were younger, they would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, terrible font.
customer_reviews.text: I had been wishing I had something like this for my 5 year old to learn CVC words and was very excited about this. It is a great idea and the quality is nice, but the font they used was a very bad choice. It’s lowercase which isn’t a big deal, but they are italics and for a beginner, very difficult for them to read the letters. Wish it was a simple font.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Solid, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: The reading blocks were received in fine working order. I had read a review concerning the letter "i" on the cubes, and it can easily be confused for a "j" by a young reader. Easy fix; I found a non toxic flesh tone nail polish and covered the bottom of the letter.
customer_reviews.author: ANGEL A CONVEY

customer_reviews.title: Not sight words
customer_reviews.text: Seriously? Words like “bob, bop, rig, cob.” I understand these words exist but these are not sight words; these fail to even use words that are commonly used words for children or words frequently used in children books. But, these are nice quality, perfect size for children but the words used makes these not as useful and definitely not worth the money. If I kept these, it’s only because of the quality and my kid was excited to play with them.
customer_reviews.author: MommySchoolBear

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my special needs son. Big fan of Maria Montessori, so decided to utilize her method as part of homeschooling. Smaller than expected, but still an awesome toy/educational tool.
customer_reviews.author: becca n brian

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: These will last in the classroom.... but you want to make sure they script used is the same you are using in the classroom or you may find some confusion from your youngest learners.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made and my child that doesn’t always want to try reading, loves these! The only thing I don’t love is the font. The curved bottoms confuse my kids. Time that should be sent reading is used deciphering letters. I would not buy this product again for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Morris

customer_reviews.title: Good size, kids loves them
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak for their long term durability since we just got them, but I'm pleased. I expected them to be a bit bigger but they really are the right size for little hands. The letter cubes spin easily, making plenty of words quickly and easily. My 5-year-old loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great transitioning tool
customer_reviews.text: The use of the wooden reading blocks practice word families, develops eye and hand coordination, and best of all offers the ability to be used as an independent transitioning activity for those that finish early or when having a slight delay before moving forward to the next activity. These are a wonderful addition to the reading, language, or writing centers.
customer_reviews.author: Traci Lawson-Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Bad font printed on cubes
customer_reviews.text: I wish the text printed on the cubes were better. They’re printed in a strange cursive font and is confusing for kids. For example, their lower case i looks like a backwards lower case j! And some of the letter combinations created words that made no sense.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent learning tool.
customer_reviews.text: The Montessori method of learning is amazing. These blocks really help give the concept of reading and word/sound patterns. They are well made. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great teaching tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a really handy tool to teach the fundamentals of rhyming (and in turn, reading). Each set of blocks is carefully planned out so that only real words are formed regardless of how you spin the letters. There is even an insert included that explains the meanings of some of the more obscure words. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: jenny

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how inexpensive these are. I expected them to arrive as total garbage, but they are pretty awesome. I have a set of these from an authentic Montessori supplier, and the difference is that these could use a heftier finish for heavier use, otherwise they are the same. I would absolutely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan K

customer_reviews.title: Love at 1st Sight!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this learning tool for my four year-old granddaughter at Christmas, and the Wooden Reading Blocks were an instant hit. She loves learning to spell and the blocks were perfect for reinforcing her studies ar school. She is very hands on and the bold colors are appealing. It was a very wise purchase. I love seeing her enjoy them.
customer_reviews.author: Marian Ayana Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: Great educational toy!
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a teacher, what a perfect educational toy for a preschool age or kindergarten child. A great toy for the price. Be sure to play with them and model how to use it before leaving it in the toy box!
customer_reviews.author: tracy

customer_reviews.title: Good Hands-On Activity
customer_reviews.text: These are fun for kids learning to read. Each piece has the same vowel in the middle and several different consonants to rotate around to make different short 3 letter words. Good hands on activity.
customer_reviews.author: sbee

customer_reviews.title: Rhyming practice in the back seat!
customer_reviews.text: Good for practice with rhyming, handy to take in the car; good reinforcement of vowels vs. consonants. Biggest gripe is that the font makes the “i” look like a “j” . Limited number of words but that’s to be expected. Newest challenge is to write as many words as he can remember when we get home and keep track of high scores!
customer_reviews.author: ddb602003

customer_reviews.title: Great Educational tool.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Creative Kids Wooden Blocks because it is the simplest way to teach 3-letter words. I have always looked for a simple hands on way to teach this topic. My kids online love it.
customer_reviews.author: Pastor

customer_reviews.title: For my 3yo
customer_reviews.text: My three year old loves to read and spell words, so I figured this would be a great toy for car rides. He will be so happy and I don’t have to let him have my phone or tablet 😊
customer_reviews.author: Amber_ReneeTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Totally Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be the worst gift of many. Nope, kids played with this the most. 4 & 6, one learning letters the other beginning to read. Perfect for either age, makes sounding out words easy, 3 letters, all you have to do is change a letter. Kiddo remembers the original sound of the two letters but changes the sound of one letter changes the word. Spend $300 per kid on gifts, this was the cheapest, played with it the most, go figure.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Yes please
customer_reviews.text: These are such a bargain. And such great quality. Skip the expensive ones and choose these instead. Fast delivery and exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Van Kuiken

customer_reviews.title: Ok toy
customer_reviews.text: My 4year old got bored with the toy after a day. I would recommend the word puzzles compared to this toy. I regret purchasing but of course every kid is different.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Good quality movable word blocks
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these movable word blocks to work with my 2 year old daughter on her phonics. They are great, well made and easily movable to form several small words.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri

customer_reviews.title: Love as a mom and teacher
customer_reviews.text: Great for early readers (pre-k through 1st). My 5 year old who hasn’t entered Kindergarten yet loves to build words and have me read it too! As a pre-K teacher, it’s a wonderful way to practice the CVC reading with kids in a fun hands on way!
customer_reviews.author: Burt

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Good overall. Could use some improvement. Not all the words align to make useful words. There were probably better combinations that could have been used.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: My son had fun practicing reading with these! Great educational toy blocks!
customer_reviews.author: ScreenRedemption

customer_reviews.title: Easy learning tool to carry in your purse
customer_reviews.text: Great learning tool for on the go. I carry these in my purse so my son has something to play with when out.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality reading skill tool
customer_reviews.text: Durable product. Great way to reinforce early reading skills. Glad I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: senior sue

customer_reviews.title: Colors
customer_reviews.text: I wish the balls on the end were a different color so the kids can remember which color to have in the left and right hands so this reminds them which way the letters go.
customer_reviews.author: emily474

customer_reviews.title: Great economical alternative
customer_reviews.text: These are usually expensive, but I found these on Amazon and the quality is great! We love wooden toys, I think this will last for generations.
customer_reviews.author: JBB

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: These little word toys are adorable. My daughter isn’t quite ready to use them yet but I’ve looked them over and they’re great quality!
customer_reviews.author: HShelton

customer_reviews.title: Helped my child finally learn to blend
customer_reviews.text: My 5-year-old has known his letters and all the sounds for a while, but I was having such a hard time getting him to blend. As soon as I bought this for him, it just seemed to click! Great educational toy
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Cycler

customer_reviews.title: questionable paint
customer_reviews.text: fine print on box indicated the paint may rub off. I was worried about my 6 year old granddaughter playing with it as it was made in China and I did not read that it had passed any standards. Also I was charged for the return, so I only got back part of the cost of the item.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic price!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! And the price is excellent for the quality. So happy we purchased these! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Clara

customer_reviews.title: Good idea not practical
customer_reviews.text: As the letters are script on some my granddaughter gets confused. They should be either all printed capital or small letters.
customer_reviews.author: Spookysmom

customer_reviews.title: Preschooler approved
customer_reviews.text: These are a fun learning toy. My preschooler loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Chicken Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My son goes to Montessori school and we bought this to practice over the summer. He likes this “game” and twisting the blocks to make new words
customer_reviews.author: LSun

customer_reviews.title: Font not a problem and pleased
customer_reviews.text: The 4 year old can use these and read the font without problems. These are well made and should be great.
customer_reviews.author: cn/mn

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: I would buy these again and again. These CVC words are perfect for kids who need to have something in their hands to play with. My four year old was so excited to be able to read these words. They would also be great in a preschool or kinder class room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reading & Rhyming in a Fun Way
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old grandson loves changes the letters to make new words. I particularly like that the vowels are painted blue.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! I already have a set but bought these for my daughters teacher and she loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Angelina Perez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Fun for car rides and office visits to keep little hands busy and learning!
customer_reviews.author: angela jones

customer_reviews.title: Semi script lettering
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for 2.5 year old. I like the easy words and she was getting a handle on it but I think some of the word combinations are off and other words would have made more sense. Also, the lettering is “partial script” not what most kids see (block letters$
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Low quality control. Inconsistent.
customer_reviews.text: Some don't make actual words. One of them is too tight for the letters to turn easy.
customer_reviews.author: Hether Parker

customer_reviews.title: this has been fun
customer_reviews.text: my kids have enjoyed using these for reading practice. i think adding the hands on aspect to it has helped
customer_reviews.author: Lori K Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have a preschool and I used this with our older children. They are sounding out the words and making new words. I love this Product!
customer_reviews.author: Teri Fisher

customer_reviews.title: It’s useful and helpful
customer_reviews.text: This the best source to start our children’s reading and recognizing the letters.👍
customer_reviews.author: Shubhra

customer_reviews.title: A good size and fun
customer_reviews.text: Cute, simple and fun. This toy is old school but still loved by kids. Very fun and a good suze for childrens hands and coordination.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: 10 Stars
customer_reviews.text: These made me a hit with the grandchildren really really helps them to learn to read
customer_reviews.author: Linny

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: Great for my 4 yer old grandson. Learning ending and beginning sounds and rhyming words. Also, helps him understand vowels
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Tavangaran

customer_reviews.title: Great educational toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my three year old. He loves playing with them.
customer_reviews.author: H. Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect learning to read!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to have another way of practicing phonics which isn't so boring!
customer_reviews.author: VC.

customer_reviews.title: Great for anyone learning to read
customer_reviews.text: This has really helped my 4 year old learn to read. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: LA Ideas

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to teach 3 letter words
customer_reviews.text: My children weren't interested with this item at first, but I notice a change. Both my 4 and 2 year old are identifying the letters. We'll continue to practice.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Vega

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful with reading
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son who is autistic. I they are nice because they are solid and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Karrie

customer_reviews.title: FUN!
customer_reviews.text: Our granddaughter (aged 4) loved these and what was nice is that her 16 month old sister also could hold them and look at them and it was not a choking hazard for her. Also easy to throw in your purse or in the car for playing. She was requesting to play with them with her Poppa before bed every night.
customer_reviews.author: Mommalisa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived as expected and I am very pleased with the quality. Feels sturdy and letters spin to change words easily and my 6 year old son is able to maneuver them on his own. This is great for reinforcing the vowel sounds for my disinterested beginner reader.
customer_reviews.author: Kml123

customer_reviews.title: Educational
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves it, practiced words all day
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Osammor

customer_reviews.title: Tiny!
customer_reviews.text: About half the size I thought it would be. Especially for about $30 it was tiny enough for my baby to play with, but I was expecting something more substantial for my kindergartener to actually use. Wish it were larger but the idea works well.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: Great learning tool. My granddaughter loves it and is learning while she plays
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Word blocks
customer_reviews.text: Such a great tool to use to teach kids how to read
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Reading Tool for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: We have upcoming new readers. This is very nice! I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised. Well made. Good for helping or teaching kids to read at home.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay & Daveron & Little Lindsay Levi - FL

customer_reviews.title: My Grandsons have fun AND learn 😄
customer_reviews.text: My Daughter, Jessi, does Home Schooling with our 3 Grandsons. She loves them! They have fun while learning! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Lord

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to teaching soft vowel words families
customer_reviews.text: This had a nice amount of good three letter word combos. I did turn it for my 4 year old granddaughter. They sound very easily and moved on her before she could sound it out. That's my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Magnelli

customer_reviews.title: Tot
customer_reviews.text: Very educational and easy to carry around and put up.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Smith

customer_reviews.title: Misprint in my order but overall product is great!
customer_reviews.text: We received our item and there were two "o" and no "u" pieces. I'll probably just fix it myself with paint. I do LOVE the product, though. They're learning fun you can keep in your purse.
customer_reviews.author: MamaB

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson who just turned 5. He is starting to learn sight words in kindergarten and he loves playing with these blocks.They are easy for him to use and he loves being able to make words.
customer_reviews.author: J A H

customer_reviews.title: Great for early literacy development
customer_reviews.text: These are great for practicing early word recognitions and rhyming. Great for my nearly 5 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Nahir Torres

customer_reviews.title: very solid!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to start working with my sons the reading skills and we really enjoy it. they are also very well built. very good price for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: I. Ali

customer_reviews.title: Good but not amazing
customer_reviews.text: Good product but some of the words aren’t actually words eg med. My 4 year old son likes them though and has started reading a few of the words.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for instruction!
customer_reviews.text: I use these blocks in my first grade classroom in small group instruction and then in literacy stations. The kids love using this manipulative to read ans spell cc words!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Galluppi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent play and learning
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Excellent quality. Durability. The blocks move easily. Makes for great fun.
customer_reviews.author: JoAngela

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Letters resemble cursive rather than standard lowercase letters. I should have taken a better look at the item before purchasing.

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: They are smaller then expected but look good for price

customer_reviews.title: Expensive for the item
customer_reviews.text: Works good. But its expensive for the size no of pieces

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: These are great! They turn easily and very sturdy. Great for working on CVC words.
customer_reviews.author: megan herman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy! I wish the letters weren’t in a strange font. Some are hard for kids to recognize.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Drable educational good investment. Good learning tool.
customer_reviews.text: My autistic great grandson did not put these down from the time he opened the package
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Wade

customer_reviews.title: My nephew loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My nieces son is four and is autistic. He absolutely loves these blocks. He is so smart he immediately started spelling words.

customer_reviews.title: Great fun learning tool!
customer_reviews.text: I leave these on the coffee table so they are readily available for anyone to pick up and fidget with.

customer_reviews.title: Is as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great aid for kids learning to read.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the beginner reader
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a gift for my niece. She loves using them to learn new words!

customer_reviews.title: Educational
customer_reviews.text: Loved this! My 4 year old is having fun sounding out word!

customer_reviews.title: Engaging to blend
customer_reviews.text: Helping children how to blend . sounds together to make words.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Introducing Reading
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Perfect for kids knowing all letter sounds wanting to learn to blend/read

customer_reviews.title: Good price but a little small.
customer_reviews.text: They were a little smaller than we expected them to be.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for learning letters
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter to help her learn her letters and the sounds they make. The only thing I don't like is that some of the letters are swirly at the bottom which confuses her a little because the teacher uses straight lines. Not a huge deal. I told her what they were but for this level of tool I would have liked it to be typewriter font rather than the swirly font they used.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Belk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! A must for your little one!
customer_reviews.text: My kindergartener loves learning how to read with these blocks. She loves how she can participate by switching up letters for new words. These make reading fun! A must!
customer_reviews.author: Lovely

product_meta.title: Wooden Reading Blocks | [5] Sets of Fun, Educational Spinning Alphabet Manipulative Blocks for Children w/ Easy-Grip Handles | STEM & Montessori Approved Toy for Pre-Kindergarten Boys & Girls Gift
feature_bullets: HELP YOUR TODDLER LEARN NEW WORDS – Premium Montessori Alphabet Blocks from Young Hands Help Children Discover & Learn New Words & Their Meanings; Includes [5] Handheld Sets of Rotating Blocks That Spin to Form 3-Letter Words

DURABLE, HEAVY DUTY CONSTRUCTION – Lightweight, Eco-Friendly Toys are Made of Resilient Wooden Materials; STEM Game Endures Many Years of Use & Abuse for Children Ages 3+; Non-Toxic Design is Safe for Kids & Easy on the Environment

SPARK IMAGINATION, ENCOURAGE LEARNING – Promote Your Preschooler’s Creativity, Stimulate Their Curiosity & Boost Confidence as They Build Vocabulary & Acquire Definitions of Various Words; Spend Quality Family Time While Learning

ONE-OF-A-KIND BIRTHDAY GIFT IDEA – Surprise Your Son, Daughter, Nephew, Niece, Granddaughter or Grandson w/ a Unique Set They Will Cherish Forever; Easy-Grip Handles & Fun, Exciting Spinning Letter Bricks are Perfect for Small Hands

100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEED – If You & Your Toddler Are Not Completely Thrilled w/ These Cool Letter Learning Blocks, Enjoy a Full Refund, No Questions Asked; Lowercase Letter Blocks Provide Hours of Enjoyment from 36 Months On!
